title: How To Do Amazon Keyword Research With Helium-10 | Full Tutorial 2025

tactics.name: Magnet Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Helium-10's Magnet tool to aggregate related keywords by applying filters like search volume, competing products, and word count.
steps: Save high-value keywords to a list
source_quotes: 70% of Amazon Shoppers never click past the first page of search results

tactics.name: Competitor Keyword Spying
tactics.description: Use Cerebro to analyze competitors' keywords and identify high-performing terms
steps: Sort remaining keywords by IQ score
source_quotes: we want to find keywords that he is ranked for on pages one only

tactics.name: Keyword Folder Management
tactics.description: Organize keywords into folders to avoid duplication
steps: Create new keyword folder in Helium-10
caveats: Manual cleanup needed for large datasets
source_quotes: it'll take out the duplicates so you don't have to worry about that

tactics.name: Keyword List Validation
tactics.description: Use Helium-10 to compile and validate keywords by checking product images and metrics
steps: Add keywords to a list via Helium-10
Use Product Launchpad to analyze search volume, sales, and competition
caveats: Ensure keywords align with product relevance
source_quotes: hover your mouse over the keyword phrase and it'll show you the product images on page one

heuristics.name: Magnet IQ Score Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has a high Magnet IQ score (search volume vs. competition), prioritize it for listings
source_quotes: High Magnet IQ score means high search volume compared to competitors

heuristics.name: Competitor Filtering Rule
heuristics.condition: If competitor has <300 reviews and >$5k/month sales, prioritize
source_quotes: find competitors who are relatively new don't have a ton of reviews

claims.statement: 70% of Amazon shoppers never click past the first page of search results
source_quotes: 70% of Amazon Shoppers never click past the first page of search results

claims.statement: Cerebro reveals both organic and sponsored keywords competitors are using
source_quotes: keywords that they are sponsored for AKA Amazon ads

claims.statement: Helium-10's Product Launchpad provides insights into potential product ideas by analyzing keyword metrics
source_quotes: Product Launchpad is one of the coolest tools to validate product ideas

niche_patterns.description: Target specific product variations with long-tailed keywords
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Long-tailed keywords reduce competition and align with buyer intent
source_quotes: Longer search phrases (3-5 words) are more niche and specific

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience needs with product constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances product functionality with buyer limitations
source_quotes: find competitors who are relatively new don't have a ton of reviews

niche_patterns.description: Target specific product categories with tailored keyword analysis
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Focuses on high-relevance keywords with manageable competition
